articles.title: BJP's Saroj Pandey wins lone Rajya Sabha seat from Chhattisgarh
articles.description: Pandey polled 51 votes, while Sahu secured 36 votes in the election held at the state assembly complex, wherein 87 of the 90 state legislators cast their votes.

articles.title: BJP will win Chattisgarh again, Ajit Jogi not a factor: Brijmohan Agrawal

articles.title: Nomura sees a 25% chance of Narendra Modi calling an early election
articles.description: The advancing of Lok Sabha elections, if that happens, will make them coincide with  state elections in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh.

articles.title: BJP's Saroj Pandey wins Rajya Sabha poll from Chhattisgarh
articles.description: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) national general secretary Saroj Pandey has been elected to the Rajya Sabha, defeating Congress rival in the election for the lone seat for which polling was held on Friday.

articles.title: Rajya Sabha Elections 2018: The Politics And Contests
articles.description: Of the 58 vacancies from 16 states that the Rajya Sabha election 2018 seeks to fill, voting will take place in six states -- Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Karnataka, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh and Telangana - to elect 25 lawmakers to the upper house.

articles.title: The bigger picture: How the Karnataka election can impact upcoming assembly elections, LS polls
articles.description: The outcome in Karnataka will y galvanise the BJP and the Congress and could have a significant impact on assembly polls due in Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Mizoram later this year.

articles.title: Election for 58 Rajya Sabha seats on March 23
articles.description: Election for 58 Rajya Sabha seats on March 23While the last date of nomination is March 12, counting of votes for all seats will be held on March 23, Election Commission said in a statement.
